title: Georginio Wijnaldum sends title race warning to Liverpool teammates
text:

Georginio Wijnaldum has urged his Liverpool teammates to ignore any talk of them being champions despite racing into an early eight-point lead.

The Reds have stormed to the top of the Premier League table after picking up maximum points in their opening eight games.

Wolves ' defeat of defending champions Man City on Sunday has prompted claims that Liverpool are now on course to end their 30-year wait for a title.

But Wijnaldum warned his fellow Reds against complacency, and that there is still plenty of work to be done.

"We don't want to think we are already champions. That would be a really wrong thing to do," Wijnaldum told Sky Sports .

(Image: Getty Images)

"I'm sure the manager will keep us with our feet on the ground and say that we just have to think about ourselves, and try to play good and try to give 100 per cent every week.

"We just have to do what we did before and look at ourselves and not look too much to other teams because we don't have influence on other teams - we can't control the performance of other teams.

"We just have to make sure we are ready for the games that are to come and to make sure we are ready and try to have good results because we know that it can change quickly.

(Image: Getty Images)

"Then at the end of the season we will see where we stand."

Liverpool let a seven-point lead over City slip last season and missed out on the title by a point.

Wijnaldum's sentiments were echoed by Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk, who was aware of the size of the challenge to displace City.

"We tried last year and unfortunately Man City was just a little bit better,” van Dijk said.

(Image: Offside via Getty Images)

“So far we have been getting the points.

“There’s always room for improvement in our game and, what I said already before, I think we should just focus on the games ahead of us and don’t look at any gaps or any points difference between us and the others, us and City.

“There are a lot of busy periods coming up as well, obviously with December, January.

“Anything can happen still.”
description: The Liverpool midfielder has been a vital cog in his teams impressive start to the Premier League season
